data.text: So I don't get how this is safe @FAANews @FAASafetyBrief this little yellow biplane has been flying back and forth this close to our cabin near kiptopeke state park all morning. At least 15 times directly over us. trees are about 50 feet high. https://t.co/dYeK9TaEAV

"@Virgin Group said ... that neither it nor #Branson was aware of an @FAAnews investigation at the time of the share sale"

How believable is that? Branson knew he had a problem when spaceship strayed upon re-entry! This is insider trading, pure & simple! https://t.co/KnIZ4ROjRK

Fine, jail time, ban these people from all future flights.
There must be accountability and prosecution for this, stop this now @TheJusticeDept @FAASafetyBrief

@Stuck4ger @BorhamAndrew @FAANews @virgingalactic So it's not an SRB?

@MIG1492 @Stuck4ger @BorhamAndrew @FAANews @virgingalactic 1. It does not matter if the technology is obsolete. Hybrid engines are what is what they are currently using. 2. Virgin Galactic did not make that drawing. I traced it back to this: https://t.co/0ysjisRQ5F
@MIG1492 @IntRocketLaunch @BorhamAndrew @FAANews @virgingalactic Oh, snap, busted.
@IntRocketLaunch @BorhamAndrew @FAANews @virgingalactic It’s a hybrid that looks identical to what you showed but without those COPVs in the wing

@IntRocketLaunch @Stuck4ger @BorhamAndrew @FAANews @virgingalactic That's obsolete technology. The VG team is working on the next generation of spaceships using field propulsion which does not use any conventional fuel. And it's eco-friendly also.
Here's a leaked prototype sketch: https://t.co/PKpalfSZG1

@Stuck4ger @BorhamAndrew @FAANews @virgingalactic Apologies for using that image. I did not know the exact context behind it and I purely used it to show the craft was powered by a hybrid engine.
So do you still think SpaceShipTwo is powered by an SRM?

@IntRocketLaunch @BorhamAndrew @FAANews @virgingalactic That is the configuration of SS2 Enterprise on the accident flight. Those blue “fuel tanks” were only installed for that powered flight. But the basic design is reasonably accurate of the current configuration.
@Stuck4ger @BorhamAndrew @FAANews @virgingalactic Yeah it uses a hybrid https://t.co/IKNMZH1Qwj
